security_audit.summary: This skill contains pure documentation and code examples for Payload CMS development. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or credential handling patterns were detected. All content is educational reference material showing TypeScript patterns for CMS configuration.

content.user_title: Build Payload CMS Applications with Expert Guidance
content.value_statement: Payload CMS development requires understanding complex patterns for collections, hooks, access control, and database adapters. This skill provides comprehensive reference documentation to help you build secure, type-safe CMS applications faster.
actual_capabilities: Configure collections with authentication, uploads, versioning, and drafts
Implement role-based and row-level access control patterns
Create collection and field hooks for business logic
Build custom REST API endpoints with proper authentication
Query data using Local API, REST, and GraphQL
limitations: Documentation only - does not execute Payload operations
Requires existing Payload CMS project setup
Does not include deployment or hosting guidance
Limited to Payload CMS version 3.x patterns

best_practices: Always pass req to nested operations in hooks to maintain transaction atomicity
Set overrideAccess to false when passing a user to Local API operations
Use context flags to prevent infinite loops in afterChange hooks
anti_patterns: Passing user to Local API without overrideAccess: false bypasses access control
Omitting req in hook operations breaks database transaction safety
Updating the same document in afterChange without context guard causes infinite loops

faq.question: Which databases does Payload support?
faq.answer: Payload supports MongoDB, PostgreSQL, SQLite, Vercel Postgres, and Cloudflare D1 through database adapters.

faq.question: Is there a limit to collection or field count?
faq.answer: No hard limits exist. Performance depends on your database and query patterns. Use indexes on frequently queried fields.

faq.question: How do I integrate Payload with my existing Next.js app?
faq.answer: Payload installs directly in your Next.js app folder. Configure payload.config.ts and add the admin route handler.

faq.question: Does Payload store my content securely?
faq.answer: Payload stores data in your own database. Security depends on your access control configuration and infrastructure setup.

faq.question: Why are my access control rules not working in Local API?
faq.answer: Local API bypasses access control by default. Add overrideAccess: false when passing a user parameter.

faq.question: How does Payload compare to Strapi or Sanity?
faq.answer: Payload is Next.js native with TypeScript-first design. It runs in your app with full code control, unlike hosted solutions.
